headline.main: Ireland May Widen Inquiry After 'Appalling' Discovery of Baby Remains
headline.print_headline: Ireland May Widen Inquiry After 'Appalling' Discovery of Baby Remains

lead_paragraph: Ireland will widen an inquiry into former Church-run homes for unmarried mothers if needed, Prime Minister Enda Kenny said on Monday, calling the discovery of long-dead babies at one home "truly appalling".
snippet: Ireland will widen an inquiry into former Church-run homes for unmarried mothers if needed, Prime Minister Enda Kenny said on Monday, calling the discovery of long-dead babies at one home "truly appalling"....
